damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit it moved over during that move and roll six D6: for each 5+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
other.name: Blackstar Cluster Launcher

wargear.description: Ranged weapons equipped by the bearer have the [IGNORES COVER] ability.
wargear.name: Auspex Array

wargear.description: The bearer has the Smoke keyword.
wargear.name: Infernum Halo-launcher

datasheets.fluff: Corvus Blackstars are sleek and shrouded aircraft used to insert kill teams into heavily infested landing zones or even xenos strongholds. With a barrage of missiles, Blackstars secure aerial supremacy and sweep the target site clear before firing their hover jets and delivering their deadly payload of elite warriors.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 Blackstar rocket launchers; twin assault cannon; armoured hull.
datasheets.name: Corvus Blackstar
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 Adeptus Astartes Infantry models or one Kill Team unit. Each Jump Pack, Gravis or Terminator model takes up the space of 2 models and each Centurion or Mounted model takes up the space of 3 models.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 hurricane bolter.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 auspex array ◦ 1 infernum halo-launcher
This model’s 2 Blackstar rocket launchers can be replaced with 2 stormstrike missile launchers.
This model’s twin assault cannon can be replaced with 1 twin lascannon.

invul.info: Chaplain Cassius and Kill Team Terminator (Garran Branatar) only.

other.description: Each time this unit takes a Battle-shock or Leadership test, you can re-roll that test.
other.name: Unflinching

other.description: While this unit contains Chaplain Cassius, melee weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
other.name: Catechism of Death

special.description: Your army cannot contain both Chaplain Cassius and Kill Team Cassius.
special.name: Cassius

wargear.description: Models in the bearer’s unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against Psychic Attacks.
wargear.name: Psychic hood

wargear.description: The bearer has a Move characteristic of 12" and can move over models and terrain as if they were not there.
wargear.name: Jump pack

wargear.description: The bearer has a Move characteristic of 12" and can move over models and terrain as if they were not there.
wargear.name: Jump pack

datasheets.fluff: Kill Team Cassius is an elite squad of specialists, even amongst Talasa Prime’s ranks of Veterans. Hand-picked by Chaplain Cassius for an unauthorised mission, the kill team uncovered the first recorded Genestealer Cult alongside him on Ghosar Quintus. They have fought together many times since, and baulk at no xenos horror.
datasheets.name: Kill Team Cassius
wargear: Antor Delassio is equipped with: Long Vigil ranged weapon; Long Vigil melee weapon, jump pack.
Chaplain Cassius is equipped with: artificer crozius; bolt pistol.
Drenn Redblade is equipped with: Long Vigil melee weapon; boltgun.
Edryc Setorax is equipped with: twin lightning claws, jump pack.
Ennox Sorrlock is equipped with: Long Vigil ranged weapon; close combat weapon.
Garran Branatar is equipped with: heavy flamer; Long Vigil ranged weapon; power fist.
Jensus Natorian is equipped with: psychic Cleanse; bolt pistol; force weapon; psychic hood.
Jetek Suberei is equipped with: Deathwatch twin boltgun; Long Vigil melee weapon.
Rodricus Grytt is equipped with: frag cannon; bolt pistol; close combat weapon.
Vael Donatus is equipped with: boltgun; bolt pistol; close combat weapon.
Zameon Gydrael is equipped with: Long Vigil ranged weapon; Long Vigil melee weapon.

other.description: At the start of the battle, you can set up one Teleport Homer token for this unit anywhere on the battlefield that is not in your opponent’s deployment zone. If you do, once per battle, you can target this unit with the Rapid Ingress Stratagem for 0CP, but when resolving that Stratagem, you must set this unit up within 3" of that token and not within 9" of any enemy models. That token is then removed.
other.name: Teleport Homer

other.description: Each time this unit ends a Charge move, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of this unit must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Terminatus Assault

special.description: If a Character from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a Terminator Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

wargear.description: The bearer has a Wounds characteristic of 4.
wargear.name: Storm Shield

wargear.description: The bearer has a Wounds characteristic of 4.
wargear.name: Storm Shield

datasheets.fluff: The indomitable warriors honoured to wear hulking suits of Terminator armour are an inspiring sight to their brethren. Deathwatch Terminators carry the most powerful close combat weapons, and the strength and durability of their armour allows them to take the heaviest firepower directly into hidden xenos lairs.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: power fist; storm bolter.
datasheets.name: Deathwatch Terminator Squad
wargear: Any number of models can each have their power fist and storm bolter replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 storm bolter and 1 power weapon ◦ 1 storm bolter and 1 chainfist ◦ 1 twin lightning claws ◦ 1 thunder hammer and 1 storm shield

Up to 3 Deathwatch Terminators can each have their storm bolter replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 assault cannon ◦ 1 heavy flamer ◦ 1 plasma cannon ◦ 1 cyclone missile launcher and 1 storm bolter (this model’s storm bolter cannot be replaced)

other.description: The first time this model is destroyed, roll one D6 at the end of the phase. On a 2+, set this model back up on the battlefield, as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, with 1 wound remaining.
other.name: Unstoppable Champion

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, you can target that unit with a Stratagem even if that Stratagem has already been used on another unit from your army this phase. In addition, that unit can be targeted with a Stratagem even while it is Battle-shocked.
other.name: Tactical Instinct

datasheets.fluff: Born survivor of a feral world and formerly of the macabre Mortifactors Chapter, Artemis leads a Watch Company of Talasa Prime. Known for his instinct for xenos trickery, he still relishes the prospect of violence, whether with his blade, the mutagenic acid-fire of Hellfire Extremis or a time-warping stasis grenade.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Deathwatch Veterans ■ Proteus Kill Team
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Hellfire Extremis; master-crafted power weapon.
datasheets.name: Watch Captain Artemis
wargear: None

other.description: At the end of your opponent’s turn, if this unit is more than 6" away from all enemy units, you can remove this unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
other.name: Spectrus Doctrines

special.description: If a Character from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to an Infiltrator Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

wargear.description: Each time you target the bearer’s unit with a Stratagem, roll one D6: on a 5+, you gain 1CP.
wargear.name: Infiltrator Comms Array

wargear.description: Models in the bearer’s unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
wargear.name: Helix Gauntlet

wargear.description: The bearer has a Move characteristic of 12" and can move over models and terrain as if they were not there.
wargear.name: Jump pack

composition: 0-2 Kill Team Infiltrators with bolt sniper rifles
0-2 Kill Team Infiltrators with jump packs
0-4 Kill Team Infiltrators with combat knives
0-4 Kill Team Infiltrators with occulus bolt carbines
datasheets.fluff: Sinister, silent and all but invisible until they strike, Spectrus Kill Teams are adept in inflicting death from both near and far. Clad in close-fitting Mk X Phobos battle plate, they specialise in battlefield control and enemy destabilisation.
datasheets.loadout:
Every Kill Team Infiltrator is equipped with: bolt pistol; marksman bolt carbine; close combat weapon.
Every Kill Team Infiltrator with bolt sniper rifle is equipped with: bolt pistol; bolt sniper rifle; close combat weapon.
Every Kill Team Infiltrator with jump pack is equipped with: bolt pistol; accelerator autocannon; close combat weapon; jump pack.
Every Kill Team Infiltrator with occulus bolt carbine is equipped with: bolt pistol; occulus bolt carbine; paired combat blades.
Every Kill Team Infiltrator with combat knife is equipped with: special-issue bolt pistol; combat knife.
datasheets.name: Spectrus Kill Team

stats.name: Kill Team Infiltrator with combat knife

wargear: Any number of models can each replace their bolt sniper rifle with 1 las fusil
Any number of models can each replace their combat knife with 1 bolt carbine and 1 close combat weapon
One model can replace its bolt sniper rifle with 1 bolt carbine
One model equipped with a marksman bolt carbine can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 helix gauntlet ◦ 1 Infiltrator comms array

other.description: Once per battle, after your opponent uses a Stratagem, if this model is your Warlord and is on the battlefield, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the battle, increase the cost of that Stratagem to your opponent by 1CP.
other.name: Watch Master

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, that unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.
other.name: Strategic Knowledge

datasheets.fluff: The galaxy’s foremost xenos hunters, each Watch Master commands one of the Chapter’s vigilant fortresses. These leaders possess centuries of strategic and esoteric knowledge of the horrors assailing Mankind. In battle, the crackling blades and tailored bolts of their vigil spears destroy any xenos before them.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Deathwatch Veterans ■ Proteus Kill Team
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: vigil spear.
datasheets.name: Watch Master
wargear: None

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: Fortis Doctrines

special.description: If a Character from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to an Intercessor Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

composition: 0-4 Kill Team Intercessors with heavy bolt pistols
0-4 Kill Team Intercessors with plasma incinerators
datasheets.fluff: Further refined from Watch Master Mordelai’s original concept, Fortis Kill Teams exemplify the supreme adaptability of the Tacticus variant of Mk X power armour, seamlessly merging a variety of close support roles and deadly firepower.
datasheets.loadout:
Every Kill Team Intercessor is equipped with: bolt pistol; bolt rifle; close combat weapon.
Every Kill Team Intercessor with plasma incinerator is equipped with: bolt pistol; plasma incinerator; close combat weapon.
Every Kill Team Intercessor with heavy bolt pistol is equipped with: heavy bolt pistol; Astartes chainsword.
Every Kill Team Outrider is equipped with: bolt pistol; twin bolt rifle; Astartes chainsword.
datasheets.name: Fortis Kill Team

stats.name: Kill Team Intercessor with heavy bolt pistol

wargear: 1 Kill Team Intercessor’s bolt rifle can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 hand flamer ◦ 1 plasma pistol ◦ 1 Astartes chainsword ◦ 1 Long Vigil melee weapon
1 model equipped with a bolt rifle can replace its close combat weapon with one of the following: ◦ 1 Astartes chainsword ◦ 1 Long Vigil melee weapon
Any number of Kill Team Intercessors with plasma incinerators can each have their bolt pistol replaced with 1 plasma pistol.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model’s bolt rifle can be replaced with 1 Long Vigil ranged weapon.

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll if this unit is below its Starting Strength, and add 1 to the Wound roll as well if this unit is Below Half-strength.
other.name: Indomitor Doctrines

special.description: If a Character unit from your army can be attached to a Heavy Intercessor Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

wargear.description: The bearer has a Move characteristic of 10" and can move over models and terrain features as if they were not there.
wargear.name: Jump pack

composition: 0-2 Kill Team Heavy Intercessors with jump packs
0-2 Kill Team Heavy Intercessors with melta rifles
0-2 Kill Team Heavy Intercessors with power fists
datasheets.fluff: Comprising warriors wearing the heavier Gravis variant of Mk X armour, Indomitor Kill Teams are mobile bastions capable of unleashing the firepower of a squadron of battle tanks. Before them, hordes of xenos and monstrous beasts alike are torn apart.
datasheets.loadout: Every Kill Team Heavy Intercessor is equipped with: bolt pistol; heavy bolt rifle; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Indomitor Kill Team

stats.name: Kill Team Heavy Intercessor with jump pack

wargear: 1 model equipped with a melta rifle can have its melta rifle replaced with 1 multi-melta.
Any number of models equipped with assault bolters can each have their assault bolters replaced with 1 plasma exterminators.
Any number of models equipped with flamestorm gauntlets can each have their flamestorm gauntlets replaced with 1 auto boltstorm gauntlets and 1 fragstorm grenade launcher.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 model equipped with a heavy bolt rifle can have its heavy bolt rifle replaced with 1 heavy bolter.

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is not Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: Proteus Doctrines

special.description: If a Character unit from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a Sternguard Veteran Squad or Vanguard Veteran Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.
wargear.name: Astartes shield

wargear.name: Jump pack

wargear.description: The bearer has a Wounds characteristic of 4.

composition: 0-4 Kill Team Veterans with Jump Packs
datasheets.fluff: The sheer versatility of their weapon loadout, coupled with their durability and manoeuvrability, make it little wonder that Proteus Kill Teams have worked miraculous feats of arms on countless hostile worlds over the course of the Imperium’s history.
datasheets.loadout: Every Kill Team Veteran is equipped with: boltgun; Long Vigil melee weapon; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Proteus Kill Team

stats.name: Kill Team Veteran with Jump Pack

wargear: Any number of Kill Team Biker models can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 bolt pistol ◦ 1 Long Vigil melee weapon

Any number of Kill Team Terminator models can replace their power fist and storm bolter with one of the following: ◦ 1 storm bolter and 1 power weapon ◦ 1 storm bolter and 1 chainfist ◦ 1 twin lightning claws ◦ 1 Terminator thunder hammer and 1 storm shield

Any number of Kill Team Veterans can replace their boltgun and Long Vigil melee weapon with: ◦ 1 Long Vigil ranged weapon ◦ 1 boltgun and 1 Astartes shield ◦ 1 Long Vigil melee weapon and 1 Astartes shield
For every 5 models in the unit, up to 2 models can replace their boltgun and Long Vigil melee weapon with one of the following: ◦ 1 frag cannon ◦ 1 Infernus heavy bolter
For every 5 models in this unit, up to 2 models can replace their boltgun and Long Vigil melee weapon with 1 Deathwatch thunder hammer.

Up to 3 models can each have their storm bolter replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 assault cannon ◦ 1 heavy flamer ◦ 1 plasma cannon ◦ 1 cyclone missile launcher and 1 storm bolter (this model’s storm bolter cannot be replaced)

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the target of that attack does not have the Imperium or Chaos keywords, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.
other.name: Death to the Alien

special.description: If a Character unit from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a Sternguard Veteran Squad or Vanguard Veteran Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.
wargear.name: Astartes shield

wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.
wargear.name: Astartes shield

datasheets.fluff: Deathwatch Veterans’ skills have been honed in their former Chapter for decades, sometimes centuries. Throughout their long vigil against the manifold xenos threats, each Veteran learns to arm himself so as to best contribute to the mission at hand, and squads carry an array of weapons to fell any foe.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: boltgun; Long Vigil melee weapon.
datasheets.name: Deathwatch Veterans
wargear: Any number of models can each have their boltgun and Long Vigil melee weapon replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Long Vigil ranged weapon and 1 close combat weapon ◦ 1 Astartes shield and 1 boltgun ◦ 1 Astartes shield and 1 Long Vigil melee weapon
For every 5 models in this unit, up to 2 models can each have their boltgun and Long Vigil melee weapon replaced with 1 Deathwatch thunder hammer.

For every 5 models in this unit, up to 2 models can each have their boltgun and Long Vigil melee weapon replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 frag cannon and 1 close combat weapon ◦ 1 infernus heavy bolter and 1 close combat weapon ◦ 1 missile launcher and 1 close combat weapon
The Watch Sergeant’s Long Vigil melee weapon can be replaced with 1 xenophase blade.
The Watch Sergeant’s boltgun can be replaced with 1 Long Vigil ranged weapon.

other.description: Each time this unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in this unit.
other.name: Turbo-boost

special.description: If a Character from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a Outrider Squad, it can be attached to this unit instead.
special.name: Attached Unit

wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.
wargear.name: Astartes shield

datasheets.fluff: Matching their speed, strength and firepower against the swiftest xenos, Veteran Bikers are expert hunters. Undertaking extended missions in dangerous territory, they assess their enemy’s every weakness, close off escape routes and use their velocity to enact sudden strikes from unexpected angles.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt pistol; close combat weapon; twin boltgun.
datasheets.name: Veteran Bike Squad
wargear: Any number of Veteran Biker models can each be equipped with 1 Long Vigil melee weapon.
The Veteran Biker Sergeant can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 Long Vigil ranged weapon ◦ 1 Long Vigil melee weapon ◦ 1 xenophase blade ◦ 1 Astartes shield

enhancements.description: Adeptus Astartes model only. Improve the Strength, Damage, and Armour Penetration characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons by 1. If an enemy model is destroyed as the result of a melee attack made by the bearer, at the end of that phase, until the end of the battle, improve the Strength, Damage, and Armour Penetration characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons by 2 instead.
enhancements.name: Thief of Secrets

enhancements.description: Watch Master or Techmarine model only. At the start of your opponent’s Shooting phase, select one enemy Vehicle unit (excluding Titanic units) within 12" of and visible to the bearer. That model must take a Leadership test. If that test is passed, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll; if that test is failed, that unit is not eligible to shoot this phase.
enhancements.name: Osseus Key

enhancements.description: Adeptus Astartes model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Deep Strike ability. In addition, you can target the bearer’s unit with the Rapid Ingress Stratagem for 0CP.
enhancements.name: Beacon Angelis

enhancements.description: Watch Master or Captain model only. Once per battle, after you have selected an enemy unit using the Oath of Moment ability in your Command phase, the bearer can use this Enhancement if they are on the battlefield. When they do, select a second enemy unit – until the start of your next Command phase, each time an Adeptus Astartes model from your army makes an attack that targets either of those enemy units, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
enhancements.name: The Tome of Ectoclades

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, improve the 
Armour Penetration characteristic of bolt weapons* 
equipped by models in your unit by 1 and improve the 
range characteristic of those weapons by 6.
stratagems.fluff:
Kraken rounds utilise adamantine cores
and improved propellants to penetrate the
thickest hide.
stratagems.name: KRAKEN ROUNDS
stratagems.restrictions:
You cannot select any
units that have already been targeted with
either the Dragonfire Rounds or Hellfire
Rounds Stratagems this phase.
stratagems.target:
Up to two Kill Team units from
your army that have not been selected to
shoot this phase, or one other Adeptus
Astartes unit from your army (excluding
Vehicles) that has not been selected to
shoot this phase.

stratagems.effect:
For each unit targeted, select the
Furor Tactics, Malleus Tactics or Purgatus
Tactics. Until the start of your next
Command phase, that Mission Tactic is
active for that unit instead of any Mission
Tactic that is active for your army.
stratagems.fluff:
Only a truly versatile approach to warfare
allows the tactical genius of the Deathwatch
to best the myriad xenos foes they face.
stratagems.name: ADAPTIVE TACTICS
stratagems.target:
Up to two Kill Team units
from your army, or one other Adeptus
Astartes unit your army.

stratagems.effect:
Remove those units from the
battlefield. In the Reinforcements step of
your next Movement phase, set each of
those units up anywhere on the battlefield
that is more than 9" horizontally away
from all enemy models.
stratagems.fluff:
Site-to-site battlefield teleportation is a
rare capability indeed, used only by the
Deathwatch in extreme situations.
stratagems.name: TELEPORTARIUM
stratagems.restrictions:
You cannot select any
units that are within Engagement Range of
one or more enemy units.
stratagems.target:
Up to two Kill Team units
from your army, or one other Adeptus
Astartes Infantry unit from your army.
stratagems.when:
End of your opponent’s
Fight phase.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, bolt weapons* 
  equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT]
  and [IGNORES COVER] abilities
stratagems.fluff:
Dragonfire rounds are designed to explode
just before contact, saturating foes in cover
with searing gas and flames.
stratagems.name: DRAGONFIRE ROUNDS
stratagems.restrictions:
You cannot select any
units that have already been targeted
with either the Kraken Rounds or Hellfire
Rounds Stratagems this phase.
stratagems.target:
Up to two Kill Team units from
your army that have not been selected to
shoot this phase, or one other Adeptus
Astartes unit from your army (excluding
Vehicles) that has not been selected to
shoot this phase.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, bolt weapons*
(excluding Devastating Wounds weapons) equipped 
by models in your unit have the [ANTI-INFANTRY 2+] and 
[ANTI-MONSTER 5+] abilities
stratagems.fluff:
Hellfire rounds douse their targets in
voracious acids that are utterly lethal to
organic life.
stratagems.name: HELLFIRE ROUNDS
stratagems.restrictions:
You cannot select any
  units that have already been targeted with
  either the Kraken Rounds or Dragonfire
  Rounds Stratagems this phase.
stratagems.target:
Up to two Kill Team units from
your army that have not been selected to
shoot this phase, or one other Adeptus
Astartes unit from your army (excluding
Vehicles) that has not been selected to
shoot this phase.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, each
time an attack targets your unit, worsen
the Armour Penetration characteristic of
that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff:
The belligerency and transhuman
physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make
them unyielding foes.
stratagems.name: ARMOUR OF CONTEMPT
stratagems.target:
One Adeptus Astartes unit
from your army that was selected as the
target of one or more of the attacking
unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when:
Your opponent’s Shooting phase or
the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit
has selected its targets.
